ratings.comment: Aida is AMAZING! Best professor I have ever had at UW-Madison. She is brilliant, creative, articulate, and generally lovely. 574 covered super interesting topics related to feminist literature, which is obviously one of her passions and something she is extremely knowledgeable about. I could listen to her lecture all day. Class with her was a joy!

Aida gives incredible lectures, is absolutely brilliant, and is very down to earth. I would highly recommend taking a class with her. In fact, if you don't take a class with her, you're missing out on the best professor and course of your life. There aren't many people or professors like her!
Although she is not good at giving lectures, she is very intelligent and the course material is interesting.  A lot of reading but otherwise manageable work load.

reads straight from lecture notes which use overly complex language to explain simple themes throughout the books. lecture is only mandatory to take pop quizzes and is almost useless for the midterm. Grading is strictly based on TAs and some are much easier than others. Class isnt that hard if you have a good TA but a struggle if you have a bad one

Aida is one of the best professors I've had. The course material was challenging, but Aida provided a learning environment where students' ideas were never shot down. Her intelligence is remarkable and her passion for the subject made learning enjoyable. Class is mostly focused on discussion, so be prepared to analyze theories presented in the text

Discussions & lectures rarely had anything to do with the content of the readings, even though the midterm was based solely off the readings. Reads off pre-written speech for lectures, uses unnecessary complicated language, but stutters when asked a question & has to go off her script. Nice lady, class left me disappointed.

She is very clear and concise with her lectures and makes sure not to waste any time. She is also very nice and understanding when it comes to misunderstandings or time conflicts. Take her classes if you can!

Aida is incredible. It is difficult, being an upper level English postmodern lit class, but she is so passionate about what she does and is always willing to help anyone. She is remarkably intelligent. I would recommend this class to all lit majors

The lectures were somewhat interesting but not very relevant to the class as there was only one exam and it was based off of the assigned readings. Discussion sections were much more helpful as they discussed the book rather than the history of the author.  Relatively easy class as long as you got a good TA as some were tough graders.

Prof Hussen is very passionate about what she is teaching in class, but she also keeps class light and will joke around. You need to read the books because each one has a pop quiz or short assignment, but they're all great. I'd attend lectures because powerpoints aren't online and only list main points. TA graded, get Karolyn Steffens if you can!

This class was really challenging but in the best way possible.  Aida really makes you think and won't give you answers but is so willing to meet to talk about questions.  She is easily the nicest professor I've had on campus and you can feel her passion for her work.  I would LOVE to take another class with her.

Has well designed powerpoints and interesting lectures but doesn't upload them online. You have to be a good note taker to be successful in her class. Reading is about a book a week with either a small quiz or assignment.

This class required a lot of reading, but most of the books were easy reads. The assignments were very straight forward.  Lectures could be long at times, but she was very into what she was talking about and very funny when you paid close attention to what she was saying.  A lot of this class depends on your TA.

Wonderful and intriguing lectures. Her readings and interpretations of the novels are very straightforward and interesting. Gives pop quizzes in lecture to make sure you're attending which keeps you accountable for the assigned reading. Overall, wonderful professor! Highly recommend.

Although her lectures could get long at times, overall Professor Hussen's lectures were interesting. She was passionate about the subject. There was a fair amount of reading, but the books were pretty easy to read. Assignments and essays were straightforward and not too difficult. Overall, I enjoyed the class.

Lectures are useless. She literally just writes essays for every class and reads from them. A lot of people would get up and leave. Her powerpoint slides are useless as well. Assignments aren't hard, it just depends on your TA.
An alright teacher. Really boring lectures, but an easy class. A lot of reading.
